storyInfo: Ebenholz and the spy discover a secret laboratory hidden in the sewers, and a large number of special, activated Originium slugs gush out of the ground and threaten the Afterglow, even closing in on Kreide.

attributes.content: Two men strike forward in the wide, dark sewers.
The sound of water is loud and grating, even more sinister than unbroken silence.
Hold on a minute. Make a right here.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: You sure know this place well.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Of course I do.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Something every spy should know?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The first thing every spy should know.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Then I'm sure you've already been working in the Afterglow for years.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Trying to get on my good side?
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Just curious.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You're not privy to that information.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Disappointing.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Why'd you stop moving?
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: There's something over there.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: That's the oldest trick in the book. Don't even bother.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: No, I'm serious – Look over there, something's moving.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Biegler presses the weapon in his hand against Graf Urtica's heart from behind, his eyes then following the direction of the Graf's fingers.
It's just an Originium slug. You've never seen one of those before?
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Is it really... just an Originium slug?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The high-and-mighty Graf Urtica was so scared by an Originium slug that he couldn't even walk. Now I've seen everything.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: I still think there's something not quite right...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Stop being stupid and get a move on!
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Fine.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Wait, just a second.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Isn't that an awful lot of slugs?
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: That's way too many! This is going to be a major problem!
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Run! Now!
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Why are you––
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: It's about to be too late already! Hurry up!
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Biegler grasps Ebenholz's wrist tightly, and the two of them sprint through the sewers.
Huff, huff...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Do you have a map of the sewers inside your head?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: If you have the time to quip at me, you'd be better off spending it to catch your breath.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: I'm not trying to be sarcastic, every branch we take seriously looks the same to me...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Rested up?
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: We just––
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Then keep running! Hurry!
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: (Gasps)
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I... can't keep going...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: That's fine. We just happened to find who we were looking for.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Good evening, Herr Lachmann.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Good evening, shopkeep.
attributes.name: Lachmann

attributes.content: Shopkeep?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Ugh. You don't know a damned thing, but you still have to stick your nose where it doesn't belong. What a pain you are.
attributes.name: Lachmann

attributes.content: Wouldn't you agree, Biegler?
attributes.name: Lachmann

attributes.content: Agreed.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: But you're the one who's in real trouble.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: You've provoked all the Originium slugs in this area, and they're swarming towards the surface.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: As we both know, the Originium slugs in the sewers emit a noxious gas, and what you're doing is tantamount to a chemical attack on the Infected of the Afterglow.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: A chemical attack? But aren't we fine right now?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The gas has a much stronger effect on the Infected than it does on you, Graf Urtica.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Then, Czerny and Hibiscus...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: And Kreide too...?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Good. You already understand the situation.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Lachmann, quell these Originium slugs and return them to their original state immediately, or I will exercise my right to put you down on the spot.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: It's no longer possible.
attributes.name: Lachmann

attributes.content: A lone man can start a fire easy enough, but even if you point a knife at his neck, he won't be able to put it out alone.
attributes.name: Lachmann

attributes.content: What do you people get out of this?
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: What do we get? How do you not even know that much?
attributes.name: Lachmann

attributes.content: Not interested in hearing your riddles.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: 'Pestilence from Shadow wanton spouts, spews Ruin in Prelude.'
attributes.name: Lachmann

attributes.content: Do you really need me to explain it word by word?
attributes.name: Lachmann

attributes.content: Let me rephrase. What do you get out of making the prophecy come true?
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: You don't need to worry about that.
attributes.name: Lachmann

attributes.content: What are you trying to do? Silence him?
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Just knock him out already, my dear, mean-spirited spy!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Do you have any way of controlling these slugs?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: If I did, I wouldn't be wasting my breath on him.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Then let's get going before it's too late!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: (Glares sharply)
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: You're more than meets the eye, Graf Urtica.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Fine, I'll carry him out, and you follow me––
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Wait, hold up, that's––
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Ebenholz sees the same thing Biegler sees.
Where Lachmann has fallen, something silvery is glistening on the sewer wall.
It's the keyhole.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: There might be some kind of device inside controlling the Originium slugs! I'll blow the door open––
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Let me see if I can pick the lock first.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: It'd be bad news if you blew up something important.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Can you open it?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The lock's a pretty tough nut to crack, but it won't get the better of me.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: While you're working on that, mind telling me what this prophecy is all about?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You've never heard of it?
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Well, whatever, it's spreading around anyway.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: O'er lofty Hills, the Fiend steps into Twilight's Midst agaze.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: The Blood hides Plague within, slow beckons Death to creep all Ways.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Pestilence from Shadow wanton spouts, spews Ruin in Prelude.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Fades Finale's Ensemble; Woe departs with Sun's last Rays.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Ensemble? Woe?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Right.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: To be honest, I'm still curious what the last verse means.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Everything else is already fairly clear.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: The first verse refers to Hibiscus's arrival in the Afterglow, and the second refers to the phenomenon of false recovery...
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: You even know about that?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: What do you think a spy's job is?
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Now, the third verse is also clear. All that remains is the last one.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: It's open.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Now, that's something...
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: A laboratory?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Ah, it's you. Thank you for organizing––
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Herr Czerny, the situation outside has gone to hell in a handbasket!
attributes.name: Mannered Infected

attributes.content: Swarms of noxious Originium slugs started coming up from the sewers, and a lot of people have already been poisoned. It's total chaos out in the streets now!
attributes.name: Mannered Infected

attributes.content: They're saying this is part of the prophecy, and panic is spreading through the Afterglow!
attributes.name: Mannered Infected

attributes.content: How did this all happen?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: We can't do much about people panicking right now, but how about those who were poisoned?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: They're not looking too good... Especially those whose Oripathy started getting better recently. They're having even more violent reactions.
attributes.name: Mannered Infected

attributes.content: We've already contacted the hospital, but the medical staff on the line didn't seem very motivated when they heard that we're in the Afterglow...
attributes.name: Mannered Infected

attributes.content: Not motivated?!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: I'll go negotiate with the hospital then.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: It's too dangerous outside, you'd better just call!
attributes.name: Mannered Infected

attributes.content: If they didn't care when you made the call, it won't make a difference if I'm the one on the line. This is something I'll have to take care of in person.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: But tomorrow's the day of the concert, and if you get poisoned...
attributes.name: Mannered Infected

attributes.content: If these inexplicable events result in deaths, do you think people will be in any mood to enjoy the music, even if the concert continues as planned?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: I don't want things to reach that point, nor do I want to pretend as if nothing is happening. I'd rather not play a single note than lie to myself!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Why are there so many slugs?!
attributes.name: Worn-out Infected

attributes.content: It reeks! What is this stench...?
attributes.name: Neurotic Infected

attributes.content: I'll help you, let's get out of here!
attributes.name: Worn-out Infected

attributes.content: Looks like... the prophecy is coming true...
attributes.name: Neurotic Infected

attributes.content: Damn pests, stay away!
attributes.name: Worn-out Infected

attributes.content: Krause, Krause! Get up–– *cough*, *cough*...
attributes.name: Worn-out Infected

attributes.content: Help us! Someone, anyone!
attributes.name: Worn-out Infected

attributes.content: Is someone playing the cello...? All the slugs are going in the direction of the music?
attributes.name: Worn-out Infected

attributes.content: Thank you!
attributes.name: Worn-out Infected

attributes.content: Krause, stand up. Here, hold on to my shoulder...
attributes.name: Worn-out Infected

attributes.content: Hold on tight. Let's go, now!
attributes.name: Worn-out Infected

attributes.content: (Whispers) You're welcome.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: With Kreide at the epicenter, the tones of the cello spread out across the narrow streets and alleys of the Afterglow.
Wherever the cello's notes travel, the Originium slugs turn around one after another.
Those who had been surrounded think the crisis is over, that the poison-exhaling insects will soon retreat to the dark sewers under the guidance of the cello's tune.
But they are wrong.
Both where they can and cannot see, Originium slugs make their way towards Kreide.
Huff, *pant*, *pant*...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Finally... made it...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Now what... Do I just blow all these slugs up with Arts?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: ––Something's not right here.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Now what is it, my good spy?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The Originium slugs are all congregating in one place––
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: A cello...?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Kreide, what are you doing? Stop that right now–– *cough*, *cough* *cough*!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: No yelling. It won't do any good and will only mess up your lungs.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Help me get through!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I told you, stop shouting.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: He won't stop playing just because you're shouting, and I won't stand aside just because you aren't.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Then, let's combine forces and clear a path to Kreide!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I don't think so. I'll head in the opposite direction.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Are you going back to your coffee shop?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Yes. We worked together to create an opening. Now, we will part ways.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: I'm sure you can't wait to head back to your shop and study those torn documents you retrieved from the lab, right?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I'm so glad the research notes about the Voice of Terra are so much more interesting than the lives of the Infected.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Kreide's situation is your own damned fault, so you can solve it yourself.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Also, if I find out that even a single word in those notes and plans was written by you, just you wait.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: I'll be waiting, sure enough.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: That's the end of our chat.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: We're going, on the count of three!
attributes.name: Biegler
